story:
Cholera is killing in Haiti. PureLives has a solution.

But we need your help. 

PureLives is a ground-breaking portable technology that offers a new take on filtering water for drinking purposes. With just one step, PureLives uses gravity to remove bacteria, viruses, organic chemicals, dirt and debris revealing 99.9% clean water.

In the 2- 3 minutes it takes for the filter to work, a user has 5 gallons of portable water in a backpack.

The unfortunate situation in Haiti is that cholera is contaminating the drinking supply and water nationwide.  The average family spends the American equivalent of $7,000 a year, $584 a month, $147 a week, $21 a day...on water alone...this technology can make a world of a difference. PureLives is not only a way to make the water drinkable again.

PureLives can be used by Haitian entrepreneurs to create a long-lasting sustainable solution towards economic freedom. Our goal is to empower people to save their own lives. Haitians will ultimately Be their own Water Heroes.  

Your contribution

Gifts/Perks: Do you want to get your hands on the first water filter in a backpack? Choose the Buy One Get One option. You'll be sending a PureLives unit to a Haitian family and get one for yourself to keep!

Donate $10, 25, 100 or more and receive a Water Hero t-shirt, water bottle, a photo of the family you sponosr with a PureLives product, your personal logo on the product or a PureLives unit of your own.

If you'd like for everone in Haiti to know your company cared, choose the Water Hero: Corporate Sponsor, Company Sponsor 10 or Sponsor 5 Families & Logo. 

Where Your Money Goes: The money you give will fund the production, manufacturing, shipping and distribution of over 100 PureLives to be gifted to families in Haiti. We have already done our research by speaking to individuals in Haiti about their current methods of obtaining clean water, the vast improvement PureLives would bring to the process, and the best design for the average Haitian family to use on a daily basis. The question we were asked last is “When can we have these?” Your involvement will help us answer with “Now.”

Here's how the numbers breakdown: 

It costs about $75 to get a PureLives assembled, shipped and to keep our 4 employees afloat. If we raise a goal of $7,500, that means 100 full Haitian families will receive a PureLives and a backpack. 100 families will have access to portable in-home water filters. 100 families will be saved from contaminated water. 

Your support will not only provide a most useful clean water filter to families in Haiti, but you will also receive a perk for your own use. 

 

Why PureLives?

Clean water is one of the most basic elements of human life. We all need it to survive. Still, there are 3.4 million people (WHO2008) in the world that don’t have access to it. In Haiti, where the average annual household income is $650 a year, 10 – 26% of a family's income goes to buying clean water. For the average American household that would mean nearly $7,000 of the average annual income would go into buying water alone.

The families that receive a PureLives unit from this campaign will have 3-5 years of free access to clean water.

PureLives has a different take on water than most other filters. Other filters require complicated pumps that need instruction manuals, electricity which is inaccessible for many people, or chemicals like chlorine that not only leaves a bad taste in the water, but can also pose a threat to health. PureLives, however, uses a 3-phase gravity-flow filtration system with no harsh chemicals, electricity or pumps. 

A family simply takes the filter to a nearby river, lake, stream or well, pours water into the top of the filter and in 3 mintues tops, has 5 gallons of clean water to take home. 

Our goal is to empower people to save their own lives. 

 

Our Motivation:

George Page, the creator of PureLives, has been a water filtration engineer for over 9 years. He was moved to use his experience and knowledge to help people who need it most after witnessing the devestating earthquake in Haiti. With an idea and the skills to match, George created PureLives in 2012, visited with families in Haiti to determine the practicality of its usage, and continued to shape and craft the system until now. With this final design, PureLives is ready to be used by families in Haiti who want to drink cholera-free water. 

The team of 4 and 2 interns that are working diligently to get the product out to you and the world is a group of sustainability, user-designed focused, social media aware, smart folks that care about lives being saved.

story:
Ways of the Earth Living Museum Campaign

Can you imagine growing up in a world of technology, never having played unsupervised outside? Can you imagine not knowing that the food you are eating was once a plant or animal? Can you imagine being afraid to walk down a forest trail because there might be snakes or insects? Can you imagine never having walked on anything but asphalt, concrete and artificial flooring? We don't have to imagine; we have met these people, both children and adults, by the thousands. They live in an artificial world devoid of any connection to the natural world, their lives focused around the entertainment available through their technology. They see nature as a hostile place, not anywhere they would want to be, and certainly not a place they would be comfortable.

When we become aliens in our own natural environment we lose a part of ourselves, and in so doing our behaviors reflect this disconnection. Our unawareness has led us to a time when we are doing irreparable damage to the Earth, endangering her ability to even sustain us. A way has to be found for modern children, teens and adults to re-connect with the natural world and recognize our interrelationship with everything around us.


With your help, the Ways of the Earth Living Museum will be this bridge where modern people will experience the wisdom of ancient ways and make a profound connection to the natural world that can change their life. Modern life is like our modern museums where ancient skills are displayed behind glass, with written descriptions defining interesting facts and where the very clear message is "don't touch!"  What if instead a person could hop out of their car, walk down a trail and walk back into history, to a village living in the ancient ways. They feel the grass beneath their feet. They help tan the hide of an animal that gave its life to clothe and feed the village. They go on a walk with a Resident to help them gather wild edible plants, seeing the gratitude given to each plant that gives their life to sustain us . They sit by a person flintknapping a stone knife and wonder, perhaps for the first time, how their pocket knife was created. They make a fire from two pieces of wood and touch a place deep inside themselves that responds to this connection with fire in a way unavailable by striking a match. They explore and laugh, touch and discover. They have dirt on their pants from sitting by the fire and they feel alive in a way they've never felt before. They've challenged themselves with something new and perhaps a bit scary for them. They've learned new skills and spent the day wrapped in the beauty and wonder of nature. They've had an adventure; not some movie or action game on the computer, but real, invigorating, life-expanding adventure.

We've seen this work; how transformative an experience it can be to just be given the chance to connect with nature. We've seen confidence and determination ignited by learning the skills to take care of yourself in the natural world. And we've seen how this all transforms people's modern lives, creating people who realize we need to care for the Earth, about experiencing life more fully and of finding the courage and passion to pursue the things they love. We know this experience will change lives.

And we know we need your help. We've got everything in place; a beautiful 250 acre property west of Indianapolis, IN. We have a non-profit organization in place to make sure this remains a viable, self-sustaining endeavor. We have Residents who have dedicated decades to learning these ancient skills so we can create this village to inspire, teach and create a safe place for people to immerse themselves in nature. We are at a point where we are ready to create it and there is much work that needs to be done. Before we can open, our Residents have to leave their jobs and homes to move to Indiana, build our various shelters and create all the things needed to sustain a real living village. During this time we will have the expenses of the land lease, insurance and food and supplies for the Residents and modifications on the property like installing a well, but won't be bringing in any funds yet from the museum or other various programs we will offer. If this museum is going to exist, we need people like you to agree that this is an incredibly unique and important experience worthy of your support. Your gift is needed to make this a reality.

Whether you can donate or not, if you're inspired by our project, please share with your friends on Facebook or by using the Indiegogo sharing tools! 

If you want to find out more, view our website www.waysoftheearth.org for more details of how we will change peoples' lives.  Join our newsletter for periodic project updates or follow our blog as we share the ongoing story of our move from modern life to primitive living and the stories of those who come to experience the ways of the Earth and how this has touched their lives.

Thank you for considering a gift.


"Ways of the Earth really is something special and unique.  In this time of survivor reality shows, people need more than ever to see that the real goal is not to survive long enough to go back to the “civilized” world,  but instead to learn about living in the natural world so they can “survive” back in the civilized world. " 

                                                                                      Joe Roush,  Board Member

story: Our beautiful 1890's home is being renovated (slowly), and needs a wood stove to offset the expensive fuel oil heat before winter hits again. We are mentors for eight children and would like to continue this through the winter months, provided we have a warm home.

story:
Short Summary

Clairvaux Farm has been a shelter for Homeless Families since 1981. We can shelter up to 14 in tact families at any given time. We are 16 miles from the nearest town and need a SAFE, RELIABLE vehicle to transport folks back and forth. Our parent organization is Deep Roots, Inc. We are a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization serving folks without judgement. Walking alongside them on their way to safe, permanent housing.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $2,500 to purchase a SAFE, USED, MINI VAN to transport families experiencing homelessness. Williams Chevrolet & GMC in Elkton, MD is giving us a great deal! This van retails at $9998 and they are willing to part with it for us for $2500!
  • As for 'what you get' well, frankly, we don't have the funds to send you any perks...all our money goes to the Farm. But we will acknowledge you in our Deep Roots Newsletter as a contributor! We hope you understand.

The Impact

Transportation to and from Clairvaux Farm is paramount to successful exits.

  • There is no public transportation in our area.
  • Doctor appointments, Job interviews, Apartment hunting, School, Benefit meetings are just a few of the reasons a van is needed.
  • Thousands of families have passed through the doors of Clairvaux Farm over the years on their way to safe, affordable housing.
  • We can't be there for the families without safe transportation.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help by visiting our website at www.deeprootsinc.org

  • Please remember us when hitting buttons for 'sharing'!

story:
SAVE THE MUSEUM !


We have the Historical Museum of Trot, dedicated to the horse,
a noble animal, docile and friend of man in times of peace and war.
A collection of historical documents (from 1700 to the present) artwork,
pictures,, books, vintage posters,
material that tells of the relationship between man and horse
and the birth of harness racing in Italy, as popular sport for all.
Unfortunately we are alone. It is not time for culture in Italy now.

Abbiamo il Museo Storico del Trotto, dedicato al cavallo,
animale nobile, docile ed amico dell’uomo in tempi di pace
e di guerra. Una collezione di documenti storici (dal 1700 ad oggi),
cimeli, opere d’arte, foto, libri, manifesti d’epoca, materiale che racconta
del rapporto fra uomo e cavallo e della nascita delle corse al trotto  come sport popolare.
Purtroppo siamo soli. Non è tempo di cultura in Italia, adesso.

The place is beautiful, there are countryside and horses
and the medieval towns of the Marche.
From the hills you can see the sea, blue in summer
and  gray and rough in winter.

Il posto è bellissimo, ci sono campagna
e cavalli ed i borghi medievali marchigiani. 
Dalle colline si vede il mare azzurro d’estate,
grigio e agitato d’inverno.

We would like to resist! We would like to do it! 
We would like to bring to a conclusion by the year recognition
of “cultural Italian“ initiated by the Superintendency of Fine Arts.
We want to continue to tell stories of men and horses.
On the site www.museodeltrotto.it you can better understand 
who we are and what we have done.
The Captain, our father, collected all the material in almost 50 years, 
Gi, our mother, has painstakingly tried to bring order.
Now we are there. We would like to do it, we can do it!


Vorremmo resistere! Vorremmo farcela! 
Vorremmo entro l’anno portare a conclusione
il riconoscimento di “bene culturale italiano”
avviato con la Sovrintendenza di Belle Arti.
Vorremmo continuare a raccontare storie di uomini e cavalli.
Sul sito www.museodeltrotto.it potete capire meglio chi siamo
e cosa abbiamo fatto. Il Capitano, nostro padre,
ha raccolto tutto il materiale in quasi 50 anni, 
Gi, nostra madre, ha faticosamente tentato di mettere ordine.
Ora ci siamo noi. Vorremmo farcela, possiamo farcela!



20 EUR

1 gadget museum of your choice between the shopper, 
t-shirt, cap, notes (shipped anywhere).

1 gadget museo a scelta fra shopper,
t-shirt, cappellino, notes (spedito ovunque).

50 EUR 

1 book edi. "Museum Trot" + 1 gadget museum  (shipped anywhere).

1 libro Edizioni "Museo Storico del Trotto" +  1 gadget/museo (spediti ovunque).

100 EUR 

1 night’s stay for two in Civitanova Alta, 
horse riding and a liter of oil to the Ippoparco.

1 notte di soggiorno a Civitanova Alta per due persone, 
passeggiata a cavallo all’Ippoparco ed un litro di olio locale autoprodotto.


For free admission to the museum for 2 people for the year 2014
and our gratitude!

Per tutti ingresso gratuito al Museo per 2 persone per l’anno 2014 
e la nostra riconoscenza!

story:
Our Story

The Without Walls Eco Practicum is a four-week summer environmental sustainability and action program for undergraduate students and recent grads. After a successful pilot, it is now in its second year. Participants live in an educational campus located in the heart of the Catskills, at the crossroads of the food- and watersheds of the densest urban center in the US. Each day they do field work with the region's most effective organizations, learn new techniques on the farm, practice small-scale animal husbandry, and play an active role in shaping the summer community. We are connecting bright passionate students with experts and organizations working to improve our world as we speak. For details visit our website.

This important program was developed with the lowest possible tuition, and yet it is still prohibitively expensive for some students and their families. We need to raise money for scholarships so that every student with passion and vision can attend.

 

The Impact

Who will take on the enormous environmental challenges we face? Your contribution will give students tools to build a better future.

 

What We Need

We need money for scholarships. All contributions go directly to helping students attend the Without Walls Eco Practicum.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, share this with as many people as possible. Encourage them to give - even the smallest contribution will help. Also, please check the "share tools" on this site to share this on your social media profiles. If you know students who would be interested in attending, please direct them to www.EcoPracticum.com.

Who will take on the enormous environmental challenges we face? Your contribution will give students tools to build a better future.
 


What We Need
We need money for scholarships. All contributions go directly to helping students attend the Without Walls Eco Practicum.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please, share this with as many people as possible. Encourage them to give - even the smallest contribution will help. Also, please check the "share tools" on this site to share this on your social media profiles. If you know students who would be interested in attending, please direct them to www.EcoPracticum.com.

story:
The coldest winter in memory locked Lake Sully with a thick ice and snow cover early, and it didn't thaw all winter. Most of the game fish suffocated.

With your help, we can restore the glory of this once-majestic one-acre fishin' hole.

Stock Lake Sully T-Shirt:
http://www.customink.com/designs/lakesully/ezs0-0011-78e8/hotlink?cm_mmc=share-_-sharemodal-_-copyurl&pc=SHARE-132021

story:
Our Story

Community Fruit Harvesting was started by Di Celliers on the North Shore of Auckland when she noticed fruit rotting on the ground in backyards in her community at the same time as reading newspaper reports about the growing demands on local food banks and charities providing food to needy families. Killing two birds with one stone she gathered some friends as volunteers and set out to pick the fruit. The fruit is then shared with the tree owner and local charities such as Auckland City Mission.

I read about this scheme in our local newspaper 2 weeks ago and was immediately inspired to go out picking with my family. And in just over an hour we picked over 60 kg of juicy, delicious tangelos of 2 medium sized trees. All the children involved had a great time, and then 2 days later 500-600 tangelos (full of vitamin C - perfect for winter health) were dropped off at the Auckland City Mission to be distributed.

The Impact

The Community Fruit Harvesting scheme is brilliant on so many levels:


* It builds community by connecting pickers and fruit growers in their local areas and giving them a worthwhile mission of donating healthy fruit to charities


* It creates independent local food systems by tapping into under-utilized food resources in our backyards


* It is environmentally sustainable and reduces waste by ensuring that fruit that would otherwise rot on the ground gets picked


* It educates us about the environment and gets us and our children outside. When we went picking for the first time a few weeks ago the fruit tree owner's son gave us a hand as did my own sons and it was proclaimed "More fun than watching Star Wars!"


* It helps people in need as the majority of fruit goes to charities who use it in their food boxes. It improves nutrition for these people - like the vitamin C in the tangelos we picked AND saves the charities valuable funds to be used on other foods.

What We Need

While our fruit picking experience was great, it would have been so much more productive if we just had a few simple tools. If we had some extension fruit pickers we would have been able to get 10-20% more fruit off the tangelo trees. And if the trees had been larger we would have definitely needed them.


So we are looking for are some funds to purchase the basic tools for 5 different Community Harvest Groups starting throughout the greater Auckland region. If we are successful this would give each group the basic tools they need to start.


10 x extension fruit pickers at NZ$129 (US$110) each


10 x plastic fruit crates at NZ$30 (US$26) each


GRAND TOTAL of NZ $1590.00  (US$1350 )


Any extra cash we raise will be passed on to other Community Fruit Harvesting groups to allow them to purchase similar tools. You can see Di modelling one of the extension fruit pickers in the photo.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are 3 other ways you can help:


1. You can donate the fruit you have in your backyard


2. You can volunteer to pick fruit and deliver it to local charities


3. You can spread the word about Community Fruit Harvesting for us - or start it in your local area. Di and Community Fruit Harvesting are happy to share all their knowledge (including flyers to drop in mail boxes in your area, and spreadsheets to coordinate the picking) to help you get started.

story:
Thirty years ago, it seemed imperative that something be done about stopping the wanton destruction of the world's rainforests. As a young man, I was sure the human race was smart enough to not destroy themselves for want of money.

Now, I'm not so sure of that. 

The world needs a champion of the rainforest, and it appears that champion has arrived: Chief Almir of the Surui tribe asked Google for help--and they provided the equipment and training for the Surui people to document their story.

Now, it's our turn to help.

I propose we raise $10,000 to help Chief Almir travel and share his story and his heart in person. I haven't met the Chief, and I don't have a specific venue in mind--but by raising our hands and dipping into our pockets, we can show Chief Almir and the Surui that we care about them and are willing to stand with them in support of their efforts.

This much I can promise: All of the proceeds will go to the Surui. Perhaps Google will step in and help with that. I will put in the first $20. If 499 more people of the planet will do that, we can raise $10,000 to help raise awareness for this critical project.

I have written more on the topic on the Roadturn Blog.

The Surui have a homepage at Paiter-Surui.

story:
The Climate Change Discussion just changed to a Climate Crisis Reality!

As soaring greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions drove global CO2 concentrations past 400 parts per million (PPM) in May 2013, shell shocked scientist warned  that  unless we urgently adopt “radical” measures to suppress GHG emissions ( 50% cuts in emissions by 2020,  90% by 2050) we’re headed for an average temperature rise of 3 degrees or 4 degrees Celsius before the end of the century. Four degrees may not sound like much, but make no mistake: Such an increase will be catastrophic for our species and most others.

“Heat waves of undreamed of ferocity will scorch the Earth’s surface as the climate becomes hotter than anything humans have ever experienced… There will be no ice at either pole”  “global warming of this magnitude would leave the whole planet without ice for the first time in nearly 40 million years”  Sea levels will rise 35 meters – submerging Florida, Bangladesh, New York, Washing DC, London, Shanghai, the coastlines and cities where nearly half the world’s population presently live. Fresh water aquifers will dry up; snow caps and glaciers will evaporate and with them, the rivers that feed the billions in Asia, South America and California. The ”wholesale destruction of ecosystems “ will bring the collapse of agriculture around much of the world. …. With food supplies crashing , humanity’s  grip on it’s future  will become ever more tentative. “Yet long before the temperature hits four degrees, the melting will have begun thawing the permafrost of the Artic, releasing vast quantities of methane buried under the artic seas and the Siberian and the North American tundra, accelerating GHG concentrations  beyond any human power to stop runaway warming and sealing the fate of the species. - by Richard Smith and first published in the Real-World Economics Review.

What You Can  DO About Climate Change NOW!


This is New School Solar with 

The Affordable Power Panel.

This innovative mounting system "REDUCES"  PV Solar Panel Installation Labor cost by 75%. 

It is lightweight, more safe, easy to install, guaranteed not to leak and gives a quicker Return on Investment ( ROI ).

The Flexible Thin Film Advantage

  • Reduced cost with roll-2-roll, high volume manufacturing process. Lower embodied energy cost to manufacturer equals quicker payback and less upfront expense.
  • Durable - no glass to shatter. Better hail impact resistance.
  • Lightweight - No structural roof reinforcement required. No structural engineering report required, lower cost. 
  • PV array removal is not required when re-roofing.
  • Superior performance in high heat, rooftop conditions, 50% lower losses than polycrystalline silicone modules. 
  • Superior performance in low light conditions, 40% lower losses than polycrystalline silicone modules. Produces power on cloudy days and even in the rain.
  • Can be installed on multiple slopes facing multiple directions. This will open up more roof space for energy production.
  • Superior Full Spectrum Performance.

    

Do-it-Yourself?   For Some People

                        

Plug & Play?      Close Enough

                         

This is an innovative Mounting System that attaches Flexible Thin Film Laminate PV Solar Modules (2nd Generation, Multi-Junction, PV Solar Technology) to asphalt shingle roofs, as found on over 85% of Americas homes and businesses.

The Affordable Power Panel is an easy to install, durable, lightweight, less expensive, leak free way to install photovoltaic power to your sloped shingle roof in Affordable Increments. 

Flexible thin film " Peal & Stick " PhotoVoltaic Modules as invented and developed by Stanford Ovshinsky in the 1970's ( Stan Ovshinskys' inventions from 50 years ago enabled cell phones, laptops, and flat-screen TVs ) have recently made significant gains in overall Standard Test Conditions ( STC ) efficiency ratings making it now watt for watt competitive with crystalline silicone solar modules as predominantly used today. The video below first aired on Scientific American Frontiers with Alan Alda on Feb 23, 2005.

The Idea.

http://cleantechnica.com/2010/11/22/three-innovations-that-will-make-solar-power-easier-and-more-affordable/

The article above sparked the idea for this product. When I saw the Flexible Thin Film PV Solar Module applied to a mounting system for gravel topped flat roofs, it peaked my curiosity. I thought why not apply this more durable, light weight PV Solar product to a sloped roof like on houses, churches and apartment buildings... With my 30 plus year roofing background, I designed the "Steep Slope, CIGS Flexible Thin Film PV Module, Horizontal, Interlocking, Light Weight, Easy to Install, Asphalt Shingle Roof, Mounting System with Concealed, Self Flashing Roof Anchors" , THAT WILL NOT LEAK, as described below. We currently have Patent Pending on a utility patent for the Affordable Power Panel. 


Silicone Solar Power has done an extraordinary job providing Renewable Energy from the 1950's up until now and it still does a good job, but now there's a better way.  With crystalline silicone systems it takes highly skilled engineers and technicians to design and install a PV array system. A basic 1,000 watt system will cost well over $ 4,500.00 and most homes require 4,000 to 6,000 watt systems. Well over $ 4000.00 just to get started.



With this system you can design your own PV array with our help. We have access to NAPCEP Certified engineers in the cloud that can analyze site information and provide a Permit Package you can then take to your Building Codes Department for Approvals. We have a perk on the right to do that along with other design tools.

For more System Design Tool Information - See Our WebSite www.AffordablePowerPanel.com  and go to Solar Soft Cost

With the Affordable Power Panel we have a more immediate solution that anyone can get involved with right now. Buy one (1) Affordable Power Panel. Plug it into your wall outlet and stick it where the Sun "DOES" Shine. Your'e now a part of the Solution. In the U.S. you also get a 30% Renewable Energy Tax Credit. You can get started now with a single panel and add to it as you wish. Or you can order a 6+ kW. system and have it installed by others, or you can install it yourself, we'll have instructions and YouTube videos for that. The main point is to just Do It, NOW! 


Crystalline Silicone PV Modules have glass surfaces, are framed in metal, & attached to metal racks. All adding to the array weight, making structural engineering reports and sometimes structural improvements necessary.

Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Modules are durable ( no glass to break ), have superior hail impact resistance, are light weight, & easily applied to flat, smooth surfaces.


Installing Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Modules to the flat, smooth surfaced portion of this Standing Seam Metal Roof.


Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Module being applied to the flat, smooth surfaced, TPO Single Ply Roofing Material. 


Due to Factory Mutual, FM I-90 requirements, installing a Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Module to the irregular, granulated surface of this asphalt shingle roof, is not permissible.

1. MATCHING EFFICIENCY  LEVELS: The table below indicates that the efficiency level of CIGS Flexible Thin Film PV Solar Modules have finally caught up to that of polycrystalline Silicone PV Modules.  source: PhotoVoltaic Systems, James Dunlop, third edition.

2. NEW RACKING / INSTALLATION OPTIONS: Most people would be surprised to learn that at least 25% of the equipment cost and 75% of the labor cost of rooftop installed solar kits go's into the racking system that hold the solar panels to the the roof. This technology hasn't changed much in 60 years. This process of mounting bolts through the roof surface, rails to hold the panels and wiring plus, grounding systems are time consuming, (600 volt DC) dangerous and expensive.



Each panel has an identical profile:

First Picture: Shows two separate panels. First the starter strip shown at the lower left is mechanically attached the the roof rafter through the roof and roof decking. The lower edge of the bottom panel locks into the starter strip securing it to the roof. The starter strip and the deck screws are now out-of-sight and water tight. The fastener slot at the top of the panel is now secured to the rafter, through the roof.

Second Picture: Shows the second panel locked into the first now covering the screws of the first panel making them watertight. The second panel is then fastened to the roof. The installation continues in this manner to the last panel. All screws are covered and watertight. 

Third Picture:  The screws of the last panel are covered with the head flashing that clips to the top lock. The head flashing is flashed to the roof using standard roofing practices as shown in the installation manual. The microinverters and electrical lines on the left are shielded with a raceway cover. There are no exposed fasteners, This system will not leak! 

This is no Fufu solar panel packed in plastic with batteries included to charge your cell phone. This is an industrial strength mounting system that will mount commercial quality, flexible thin film solar modules to your roof. At the end of service life for the PV module, we can strip off the   original and attach a new, much more efficient PV module. This is done while the original mounting system remains on the roof. This mounting system is "On the Roof Recyclable".


The Next Major Breakthrough in PhotoVoltaic Power is the MICRO-INVERTER

Micro-Inverters are great for Affordability and Efficiency.

Inverters are an essential piece of a solar power system. An inverter takes the power that comes from the panels, which is direct current ( DC ) and changes it to alternating current ( AC ). AC is what we have in the outlets in our homes and at work. String-Inverters are large, expensive and less efficient. Just a little shading of just one part, of just one module can severely compromise the performance of the whole array system. They generate large amounts of heat and have a short life span as evidenced by typical warranty period of just 5 years. They also require high-voltage DC wiring which is dangerous when damaged or installed improperly. Micro-Inverters use low voltage AC wiring and significantly reduce the risk of fire or injury. 



Micro-Inverters have changed everything. 

Instead of modules being wired together to create high voltage DC that is sent to an inverter near your main service panel, now each PV Module is equipped with it's own Micro-Inverter. The power is converted to 240 volts AC right at the module. This makes the system more efficient and the solar system design more flexible. These advancements have so simplified the Solar Design Process that the National Electrical Code ( NEC ) requirements pertaining to complicated DC array circuits do not apply to these AC modules, as these circuits and conductors are considered internal wiring.

Micro-inverters also eliminate the need for other balance-of-system components and lengthy installation times by a DC Certified Electrician. Again, saving you money.

You can't EXPECT, from what you don't INSPECT.

With this new technology, each micro-inverter can report it's performance to a Communications Gateway via the AC wiring and your internet router. The gateway then sends the data to the website to track the performance of each panel and micro-inverter pair. You are able to view this performance data from any where, on any PC, Tablet or Smartphone. Long gone are the days of " False Performance Promises and High DeRate Factors".

YOU  Can: 

  • Verify system health and performance at a glance.
  • View energy production by month, day or hour.
  • Analyze Performance against historical weather data.
  • Share System Performance with friends on Facebook, Twitter...
  • Compare the performance of your CIGS - Flexible Thin Film PV Module Array System to that of their crystalline silicone system.


Why CROWD FUNDING

"But it's gona take money. A whole lot a spending money... too do it right".  George Harrison says it best.

We are seeking your help to buy the necessary equipment to set up a light manufacturing facility to assemble the Affordable Power Panel. Remember, we're not the ones that have had to do the heavy lifting. Global Solar Energy Inc. ( founded in 1996 ) manufacturers and warranties the PV Module we're using ( http://www.globalsolar.com/ ). Power One,  another international company supplies our micro-inverters ( http://ow.ly/vPDzJ ). We just assemble these components onto our mounting panel. Our major expense will be for the roll forming machine. This machine is similar to that used to form steel siding panels, only it will bend a heavier gauge metal to the shape shown in the CAD drawing below.

Our machine will look somewhat like this. Approximate dimensions are W. 33.5" X H. 45" X L. 138". A machine similar to those used to form steel siding.

This panel is unique. Drawn to our patent pending design and specifications. The design and fabrication of most all the components of this machine are unique to this machine, most everything begins from scratch. 

CAD representation of our patent pending panel.


Panel lengths are determined by a multi-profile guillotine, cut-on-the-fly system, to accommodate the lengths of the multiple wattage modules to be available. This machine has the capacity to produce six ( 6 ), ten foot panels per minute. 

Our Goal

Our ultimate goal is to raise $ 293,000.00. With the understanding that about 56% of the funds raised goes to fulfilling the perks.

The First $ 35,000.00

1.  The first $ 35,000.00 of our goal will be used to build a PV system of each competing technology. An array of polycrystalline silicone PV modules and an array of flexible thin film PV modules. These arrays' will be side by side, facing the same direction and at the same angle to the sun. These arrays will be of similar Standard Test Condition ( STC ) ratings. A pyranometer to measure sunlight intensity will be installed between the two arrays. I want to make a real simple comparison of Solar Radiation Input to kWh Power Output. With the use of microinverters I'll be able to send this information to our website for everyone to view.

2. Retain a professional Web Site Developer.

3. Hire a NABCEP Certified - General Manager. 

Stretch Goal: $ 293,000.00

1.  Acquire custom roll forming machinery and necessary support equipment.
2.  Acquire initial inventory of Flexible Thin Film Modules made to our specifications to Maximize Power Density.
3.  Acquire initial inventory of Micro-Inverters, Communications Gateways, Cables and Connectors... 
4.  Initial order of 140,000 lbs. of .032 mil aluminum coil stock. Initially only aluminum will be available. 
5.  Build a working 4-5 kW. prototype system, for instructional photographs and  videos.
6.  Further develop marketing and distribution strategies.

This all requires minimum orders and up front cash commitments to manufacturers, and suppliers. We can't do it without your help.

We have patent pending status on a unique product with in an industry that experienced $ 26 BILLION in sales last year alone. The more money we have available to invest in good people, good policy and the skills to communicate that policy, the faster we become successful. With that success will come lower prices for a better quality PV Solar product.

PRODUCTION & SHIPPING

The Affordable Power Panel is a Mounting Platform for equipment that has already been developed, manufactured and guaranteed by others. Others with research and development departments within their organizations and with the financial backing of Multinational Corporations. 

 We are attaching a flexible thin film laminate ( roofing type ) material and a micro-inverter ( that already have national and international code and UL approvals ) to a metal panel that nearly replicates a standing seam metal roof system ( as used in various forms for the past 500 years ) and we shifted it's orientation by 90 degrees to stabilize module laminate migration. Shipping cost of individual panels are a major factor for now. Once quantities warrant, different options to bring those cost down will be implemented.

There are currently over 75,159,000  owner-occupied housing units in the U. S. If every homeowner bought just one 90 Watt Affordable Power Panel, that alone would add approximately 6.7 gigawatt of electrical power to the grid. To put that in it's proper perspective. We have had record years of PhotoVoltaic Solar Power installations since President Obama has been in office. The total of installations in that period equals 12 gigawatt. We hope to do for the PhotoVoltaic industry, what the assembly line did for the car business. Make PhotoVoltaic Power available to more people, at a price they can afford. 

Thank you to everyone for your time and consideration. We can't do it with out YOU.


This product proudly made in the USA

by a Service Connected Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business. 


For more information about the Affordable Power Panel, go to www.affordablepowerpanel.com

Disclaimer: All YouTube videos and articles used in this presentation are to help educate readers about the product and the seriousness of The Climate Crisis. There is no expressed or implied professional affiliations and are only used to raise awareness.

The article below just appeared in the Huff Post Green

UN Scientific Panel Releases Report Sounding Alarm on Climate Change Dangers. by Seth Borenstein  03-3-2014 as seen in Huff Post Green.  http://tiny.cc/npz3dx

James Camerons' - ShowTime Series - Years of living Dangerously -  https://www.youtube.com/user/Years?v=brvhCnYvxQQ

systems. Well over $ 4000.00 just to get started.With this system you can design your own PV array with our help. We have access to NAPCEP Certified engineers in the cloud that can analyze site information and provide a Permit Package you can then take to your Building Codes Department for Approvals. We have a perk on the right to do that along with other design tools.For more System Design Tool Information - See Our WebSite www.AffordablePowerPanel.com  and go to Solar Soft CostWith the Affordable Power Panel we have a more immediate solution that anyone can get involved with right now. Buy one (1) Affordable Power Panel. Plug it into your wall outlet and stick it where the Sun "DOES" Shine. Your'e now a part of the Solution. In the U.S. you also get a 30% Renewable Energy Tax Credit. You can get started now with a single panel and add to it as you wish. Or you can order a 6+ kW. system and have it installed by others, or you can install it yourself, we'll have instructions and YouTube videos for that. The main point is to just Do It, NOW! Crystalline Silicone PV Modules have glass surfaces, are framed in metal, & attached to metal racks. All adding to the array weight, making structural engineering reports and sometimes structural improvements necessary.Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Modules are durable ( no glass to break ), have superior hail impact resistance, are light weight, & easily applied to flat, smooth surfaces.Installing Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Modules to the flat, smooth surfaced portion of this Standing Seam Metal Roof.Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Module being applied to the flat, smooth surfaced, TPO Single Ply Roofing Material. Due to Factory Mutual, FM I-90 requirements, installing a Flexible Thin Film Laminated PV Module to the irregular, granulated surface of this asphalt shingle roof, is not permissible.1. MATCHING EFFICIENCY  LEVELS: The table below indicates that the efficiency level of CIGS Flexible Thin Film PV Solar Modules have finally caught up to that of polycrystalline Silicone PV Modules.  source: PhotoVoltaic Systems, James Dunlop, third edition.2. NEW RACKING / INSTALLATION OPTIONS: Most people would be surprised to learn that at least 25% of the equipment cost and 75% of the labor cost of rooftop installed solar kits go's into the racking system that hold the solar panels to the the roof. This technology hasn't changed much in 60 years. This process of mounting bolts through the roof surface, rails to hold the panels and wiring plus, grounding systems are time consuming, (600 volt DC) dangerous and expensive.Each panel has an identical profile:First Picture: Shows two separate panels. First the starter strip shown at the lower left is mechanically attached the the roof rafter through the roof and roof decking. The lower edge of the bottom panel locks into the starter strip securing it to the roof. The starter strip and the deck screws are now out-of-sight and water tight. The fastener slot at the top of the panel is now secured to the rafter, through the roof.Second Picture: Shows the second panel locked into the first now covering the screws of the first panel making them watertight. The second panel is then fastened to the roof. The installation continues in this manner to the last panel. All screws are covered and watertight. Third Picture:  The screws of the last panel are covered with the head flashing that clips to the top lock. The head flashing is flashed to the roof using standard roofing practices as shown in the installation manual. The microinverters and electrical lines on the left are shielded with a raceway cover. There are no exposed fasteners, This system will not leak! This is no Fufu solar panel packed in plastic with batteries included to charge your cell phone. This is an industrial strength mounting system that will mount commercial quality, flexible thin film solar modules to your roof. At the end of service life for the PV module, we can strip off the   original and attach a new, much more efficient PV module. This is done while the original mounting system remains on the roof. This mounting system is "On the Roof Recyclable".The Next Major Breakthrough in PhotoVoltaic Power is the MICRO-INVERTERMicro-Inverters are great for Affordability and Efficiency.Inverters are an essential piece of a solar power system. An inverter takes the power that comes from the panels, which is direct current ( DC ) and changes it to alternating current ( AC ). AC is what we have in the outlets in our homes and at work. String-Inverters are large, expensive and less efficient. Just a little shading of just one part, of just one module can severely compromise the performance of the whole array system. They generate large amounts of heat and have a short life span as evidenced by typical warranty period of just 5 years. They also require high-voltage DC wiring which is dangerous when damaged or installed improperly. Micro-Inverters use low voltage AC wiring and significantly reduce the risk of fire or injury. Micro-Inverters have changed everything. Instead of modules being wired together to create high voltage DC that is sent to an inverter near your main service panel, now each PV Module is equipped with it's own Micro-Inverter. The power is converted to 240 volts AC right at the module. This makes the system more efficient and the solar system design more flexible. These advancements have so simplified the Solar Design Process that the National Electrical Code ( NEC ) requirements pertaining to complicated DC array circuits do not apply to these AC modules, as these circuits and conductors are considered internal wiring.Micro-inverters also eliminate the need for other balance-of-system components and lengthy installation times by a DC Certified Electrician. Again, saving you money.You can't EXPECT, from what you don't INSPECT.With this new technology, each micro-inverter can report it's performance to a Communications Gateway via the AC wiring and your internet router. The gateway then sends the data to the website to track the performance of each panel and micro-inverter pair. You are able to view this performance data from any where, on any PC, Tablet or Smartphone. Long gone are the days of " False Performance Promises and High DeRate Factors".YOU  Can: 
Verify system health and performance at a glance.
View energy production by month, day or hour.
Analyze Performance against historical weather data.
Share System Performance with friends on Facebook, Twitter...
Compare the performance of your CIGS - Flexible Thin Film PV Module Array System to that of their crystalline silicone system.
Why CROWD FUNDING"But it's gona take money. A whole lot a spending money... too do it right".  George Harrison says it best.We are seeking your help to buy the necessary equipment to set up a light manufacturing facility to assemble the Affordable Power Panel. Remember, we're not the ones that have had to do the heavy lifting. Global Solar Energy Inc. ( founded in 1996 ) manufacturers and warranties the PV Module we're using ( http://www.globalsolar.com/ ). Power One,  another international company supplies our micro-inverters ( http://ow.ly/vPDzJ ). We just assemble these components onto our mounting panel. Our major expense will be for the roll forming machine. This machine is similar to that used to form steel siding panels, only it will bend a heavier gauge metal to the shape shown in the CAD drawing below.Our machine will look somewhat like this. Approximate dimensions are W. 33.5" X H. 45" X L. 138". A machine similar to those used to form steel siding.This panel is unique. Drawn to our patent pending design and specifications. The design and fabrication of most all the components of this machine are unique to this machine, most everything begins from scratch. CAD representation of our patent pending panel.Panel lengths are determined by a multi-profile guillotine, cut-on-the-fly system, to accommodate the lengths of the multiple wattage modules to be available. This machine has the capacity to produce six ( 6 ), ten foot panels per minute. Our GoalOur ultimate goal is to raise $ 293,000.00. With the understanding that about 56% of the funds raised goes to fulfilling the perks.The First $ 35,000.001.  The first $ 35,000.00 of our goal will be used to build a PV system of each competing technology. An array of polycrystalline silicone PV modules and an array of flexible thin film PV modules. These arrays' will be side by side, facing the same direction and at the same angle to the sun. These arrays will be of similar Standard Test Condition ( STC ) ratings. A pyranometer to measure sunlight intensity will be installed between the two arrays. I want to make a real simple comparison of Solar Radiation Input to kWh Power Output. With the use of microinverters I'll be able to send this information to our website for everyone to view.2. Retain a professional Web Site Developer.3. Hire a NABCEP Certified - General Manager. Stretch Goal: $ 293,000.001.  Acquire custom roll forming machinery and necessary support equipment.2.  Acquire initial inventory of Flexible Thin Film Modules made to our specifications to Maximize Power Density.3.  Acquire initial inventory of Micro-Inverters, Communications Gateways, Cables and Connectors... 4.  Initial order of 140,000 lbs. of .032 mil aluminum coil stock. Initially only aluminum will be available. 5.  Build a working 4-5 kW. prototype system, for instructional photographs and  videos.6.  Further develop marketing and distribution strategies.This all requires minimum orders and up front cash commitments to manufacturers, and suppliers. We can't do it without your help.We have patent pending status on a unique product with in an industry that experienced $ 26 BILLION in sales last year alone. The more money we have available to invest in good people, good policy and the skills to communicate that policy, the faster we become successful. With that success will come lower prices for a better quality PV Solar product.PRODUCTION & SHIPPINGThe Affordable Power Panel is a Mounting Platform for equipment that has already been developed, manufactured and guaranteed by others. Others with research and development departments within their organizations and with the financial backing of Multinational Corporations.  We are attaching a flexible thin film laminate ( roofing type ) material and a micro-inverter ( that already have national and international code and UL approvals ) to a metal panel that nearly replicates a standing seam metal roof system ( as used in various forms for the past 500 years ) and we shifted it's orientation by 90 degrees to stabilize module laminate migration. Shipping cost of individual panels are a major factor for now. Once quantities warrant, different options to bring those cost down will be implemented.There are currently over 75,159,000  owner-occupied housing units in the U. S. If every homeowner bought just one 90 Watt Affordable Power Panel, that alone would add approximately 6.7 gigawatt of electrical power to the grid. To put that in it's proper perspective. We have had record years of PhotoVoltaic Solar Power installations since President Obama has been in office. The total of installations in that period equals 12 gigawatt. We hope to do for the PhotoVoltaic industry, what the assembly line did for the car business. Make PhotoVoltaic Power available to more people, at a price they can afford. Thank you to everyone for your time and consideration. We can't do it with out YOU.This product proudly made in the USAby a Service Connected Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business. For more information about the Affordable Power Panel, go to www.affordablepowerpanel.comDisclaimer: All YouTube videos and articles used in this presentation are to help educate readers about the product and the seriousness of The Climate Crisis. There is no expressed or implied professional affiliations and are only used to raise awareness.The article below just appeared in the Huff Post GreenUN Scientific Panel Releases Report Sounding Alarm on Climate Change Dangers. by Seth Borenstein  03-3-2014 as seen in Huff Post Green.  http://tiny.cc/npz3dxJames Camerons' - ShowTime Series - Years of living Dangerously -  https://www.youtube.com/user/Years?v=brvhCnYvxQQ

story:
WHO WE ARE

Our organization, the National Parks of New York Harbor Conservancy (Harbor Conservancy for short), supports and runs programs at the National Parks in New York City. One of our programs is the Osprey tracking project we call "Osprey's Journey." Dr. Bob Kennedy, an Osprey expert who has been studying the species since the 1970s, is our scientific advisor.

THE PROJECT IN A NUTSHELL

Roughly a year ago, we put a tiny satellite tracking device on a young male Osprey named C2, who nests at Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge in NYC. We tracked him through one migration cycle to his wintering grounds in Venezuela and back and want to track him for one more year.

We also want to continue sharing the science and the story on our website OspreysJourney.com, where we give visitors the chance to witness C2's miraculous 2,700-mile migration and the challenges he faces during the nesting season -- from mating and chick-rearing to foraging for fish in safe areas, far from the dangers of city life.

THE PURPOSE

Expanding the Osprey knowledge base
By tracking individual Ospreys, as we are doing with C2, scientists answer questions critical to understanding the species and ensuring its survival.

Raising public awareness about wildlife needs in urban areas
By telling C2's story on OspreysJourney.com, we waken people to the wildlife sharing their cities and towns and educate them on the importance of preserving habitat.

Connecting people with nature
We offer website visitors an intimate, soul-stirring, connection with nature that would otherwise be out of reach.


Photo by Don Riepe.
Ospreys are just one of many species of wildlife that spend part or all of the year in Jamaica Bay. This picture shows an egret within sight of the Empire State Building. 

MEASURES OF SUCCESS

Our project has been covered twice in The New York Times -- here and here, as well as in Conde Nast Traveler, Audubon Magazine and numerous blogs and discussion boards.

Our website has received nearly 100,000 pageviews by around 21,000 individual visitors. Over 10,000 visits have resulted from Facebook sharing.

Our Osprey newsletter has over 1,000 subscribers and astronomical open and click rates, showing unusually strong interest and involvement on the part of our core audience.

WHY WE WANT TO CONTINUE

  1. To study the variation in C2's migration, mating, parenting and fishing behaviors from year to year so we can discover how he learns and changes in response to his experiences.
  2. To continue shining a spotlight on Ospreys and other wildlife living among us and reach an even larger audience.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We started the project in Spring 2012 with a bird named Coley whom we intended to track for two years. Unfortunately, after the first year, a potential safety issue developed with the backpack holding the transmitter in place. Coley was fine, but we had to start over with a different Osprey -- C2. This turned what was supposed to be a two-year project into a three-year one, so we ran out of funds.

We need $22,000 to track C2 for the 2nd year. If we get it, we will:

  1. Download and interpret the GPS data every few days during migration and every 2-4 weeks while C2 is at his nesting site and winter grounds.
  2. Gather periodic observations from the field while C2 is at the nest site.
  3. Tell the story of C2's travels on the Osprey's Journey website.
  4. Share highlights of C2's adventures in our Osprey's Journey newsletter and on the Harbor Conservancy's Facebook page.
  5. Share our research with other scientists and naturalists and with the National Park Service and American Littoral Society so they can continue to make the Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge as hospitable as possible to Ospreys.


Photo by Don Riepe.
America's Osprey population plummeted in the mid-20th century due to DDT use, which interfered with Osprey reproduction. Eventually, DDT was banned, but recovery was still hindered by encroaching development on former habitat. Environmentalists have been addressing the problem by erecting artificial platforms where Ospreys can nest. Some 20 such platforms, like this one, have been put to good use by  Osprey pairs at Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge.

OUR WAY OF THANKING YOU

We have some really exciting perks for campaign supporters, including tickets to a sunset eco-cruise of Jamaica Bay; an original Osprey watercolor by artist, naturalist and National Park Ranger Dave Taft; a private phone call on all things Osprey with our project scientist Dr. Bob Kennedy; a boat ride to C2's nesting site; and a special Osprey-themed group walking tour of the Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge. See the full list on the right. There are perks for gifts at all levels, including, in every case, our heartfelt thanks.

WHAT IF...?

If we are not able to meet our goal entirely, we will scale back on the amount of data interpretation and reporting we do. For instance, we might check in on C2 less frequently during the winter or skip the winter reporting entirely and only report on him during migration (or, if necessary, only during the return migration next Spring).

If the transmitter that tracks C2's movements is damaged or fails for some reason, our tracking will necessarily come to an end. However, we will still be able to watch for his return to Jamaica Bay and report on it on our website.

The big "if" that we hate talking about is the possibility that C2 could be injured and die -- a risk that comes with any wildlife tracking project. All we can say is that if this should happen, we would interpret the data, surmise what we can and report what happened as best we understand it.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You can give our campaign a big boost by getting the word out to your friends and family. There are share tools right at the top of the page (underneath the video) to make it easy!

* Wondering who made our wonderful campaign video? It was Simba Productions and we highly recommend them!

story:
Support New Voices Pittsburgh in presenting the 6th Annual Kinks, Locks & Twists: Environmental and Reproductive Justice Conference™ 2014, March 6-9 at Carnegie Mellon University. Visit kinkslockstwists.org for all details.

The Kinks, Locks and Twists Conference™ offers women of color and allies a unique space to explore the dynamic relationship between the health and well-being of our bodies, communities and the ecosystems in both a local and global context.

KLT also serves as an incubator to share models and develop practices to solve the problems caused by living in an increasingly toxic world. In a world that devalues the voices of women and girls and the wisdom of our foremothers, this KLT Conference offers women across ethnicities, nationalities and cultures an opportunity to remember, celebrate and connect to legacies with rich relationships to the land.

We will bring together local, regional and national leaders to discuss a wide range of issues from urban farming, food security, healthy natural hair, safe cosmetics and fracking.

ABOUT KLT CONFERENCE™ 2014
Health. Beauty. Environment.

The Kinks, Locks and Twists Conference™ was created as a signature event during Women of Color HERStory Month® - a citywide celebration of women of color hosted annually between February 15 - March 15 presented by New Voices Pittsburgh. Visit womenofcolorherstory.org for the full month of events.

The goal of the KLT Conference™ during the first two years was for women of color in Pittsburgh to discuss how our pursuit of elusive standards of beauty impacted our health and well-being. The politics of Black hair specifically served as the compelling access point for women of color to enter conversations about Environmental and Reproductive Justice.

KLT has expanded to explore a broad range of important environmental issues from the high rates of asthma in some of Pittsburgh's most marginalized neighborhoods, fracking in Pennsylvania and toxic hair, makeup and personal products and their relationship to a host of reproductive cancers.

Your contributions will provide 250-300 people - primarily women and girls of color - the opportunity to explore connections between beauty, culture, policy, media, the economy and environment, behavior change and community organizing. Since 2008, the KLT Conference™ has grown from 50 people to 200+ people in attendance with capacity exceeding expectation year after year.

Please make a donation today to support: 

  • Youth Scholarships
  • Travel Support
  • Women's Wellness Expo
  • Green Pittsburgh Tours 

ABOUT NEW VOICES PITTSBURGH

New Voices Pittsburgh is a community-based organization dedicated to the health and well-being of Black women and girls. 

Since 2004, New Voices Pittsburgh has served 10,000+ women of color through social change activism, civic engagement and leadership development. The mission of New Voices Pittsburgh is to build a social change movement dedicated to the health and well-being of Black women and girls through leadership development, Human Rights and Reproductive Justice. 

Reproductive Justice is based on our belief that all women/people have the Human Right to control our bodies, sexuality, gender, work and reproduction. To learn more about New Voices Pittsburgh, visit newvoicespittsburgh.org.

The KLT Conference™ is fertile ground for transformative information exchange, movement-building, policy and leadership development to impact the lives of women of color, our families and our communities.

Your support will make KLT Conference™ 2014 the most successful to date. Please support TODAY!

THANK YOU!

story:
Hello There!

I'm Barbara, the creator of products and head of branding at U-Bee-Well ™. Off the bat, I'll be honest.. I NEVER thought I would be a business owner. AND, honestly, I never really knew what being an entrepreneur was all about until last year. I'm coming off of a deep pursuit of folk music. Before that, I was a teacher. Go figure. 

In my pursuit of music with The Spinning Leaves (the band I am in), I wanted to use music as a tool to create community and build bridges between people everywhere. In the time I was highly focused on making my livelihood with The Spinning Leaves, we connected and became quite attached to both farming and crafting movements ALL over this country. 



After spending a month on a farm in New Hampshire that we landed on during one of our first tours, my mind and heart opened up to TRUE connection - human to human, human to planet, food from the ground.  Our last morning on the farm, I woke up heartbroken to leave, deeply knowing that this experience had forever changed my life.  I did not know, however, the ENORMOUS impact it would have on my life's work and how that month would spawn a new way of living for me, entirely.



The only thing that has remained consistent in my life, through it all, is that I want to make this world a better place.  My strange path to becoming a business owner has not always been easy, but the challenge is worth it.  Not only will U-Bee-Well be supporting beekeepers, farmers, and the communities that surround them, we will be directly advocating for the world's bees - the pollinators of the earth and a vital link in the world's food chain.  I am confident that I've found my vehicle for bettering the world - in lip balm! 



photo by; Kelsi Windmiller


My heart and soul got into U-Bee-Well once I started developing a relationship with the Philadelphia Bee Guild  http://www.phillybeekeepers.org  and the Philadelphia Bee Company , http://philadelphiabee.com  learning the true value of bees as pollinators and the problems which they are facing in our modern age.  One BIG problem facing bee colonies today in our region, is the fact that most queen bees are raised in the south and shipped north.  It is very hard for these queens to adjust to the northern climates, and many of them die off.  With the queen gone, the hives collapse.



I saw an opportunity to help change this situation.


Initially, 10% of funds from U-Bee-Well's future accounts will go specifically into a queen bee rearing program for independent bee keepers in the northeast. The BIG VISION is that, as sales increase, we will be able to start supporting independent beekeepers all over the country and all over the world.



We are turning buying a lip balm into an opportunity for everyone to help save the bees! 

 

 "Buy A Balm.  Save A Bee." 


It's a solution which doesn't involve you building your own hive or planting your own garden (although it would be fantastic if everyone did this, not so realistic..). 

photo by; Kelsi Windmiller


**U-Bee-Well is in a unique situation to do good.  Although we are a tiny start-up, we have accrued national accounts with prestigious companies such as the likes of Anthropologie and Birchbox.   And we can't let these opportunities pass by.  We need to head straight for the BIG VISION now!


**By contributing to this campaign you will be helping on so many levels. You will be not only helping a heart-felt start up with a FANTASTIC product(!!!),

YOU will be helping farms, farmers, the communities that surround those farms AND bees!


In short, I hope to help save MILLIONS and BILLIONS of bees with my endeavors here at U-Bee-Well. It is so important for ALL of us, and so I'm hoping that you will open your mind and heart to help make this business grow! 


What We Need & What You Get

**Ideally, I will raise $18,000 through this campaign. 

This money will help with;

~Getting U-Bee-Well's online branding together (making sure that it is clear EVERYWHERE that when someone buys a balm they can feel SO good about not only having a great product, but also that they are helping the world at large!)

~Buying Materials so I can hand craft the 15k lip balms!

~Getting a good Website!

~I need to update my equipment so I can make many more lip balms at a time!

~I would REALLY love to get a little machine that will help me put the labels on perfectly

~Some costly business fees, licenses and things..

...

*IF I don't make my goal, my priority will be to buy the materials to make 15,000 lip balms.

EVERYTHING will help, and buying supplies will certainly be a big deal in itself.. otherwise, not sure how I'm going to produce so many lip balms!

…

***There are INCREDIBLE gifts that you can choose from in this campaign!  In addition to the gifts, PLEASE remember that your contributions will also be a gift knowing that YOU were part of making this world a better place! 

With that said..


I am VERY very VERY excited to present this list of artists, artisans, and craftsman who have all agreed to lend a helping hand for our campaign.  Some of the artists are established, and some are up and coming. The majority of the prizes have a bumble bee theme to them.  I have pretty much used this campaign to produce my ideal store. I am hoping that through this, YOU will also fall in love with the artists involved! Some of the gifts will require some communication with me.. AND I love and encourage that communication.

In the event finances are not possible for you to contribute, simply sharing this link with your friends and families means the world!! (Thank you for THAT in advance).

Thank you so much again, for taking a few moments to watch the video, to learn about U-Bee-Well and for your support. 

Alright, Lets DO this!!

~Barbara


PS; 

Ohhh! If you LOVE the song playing, it was written by James Michael Baker (AKA Rumi Kitchen, from Johnny Showcase) and the group is The Spinning Leaves! Check 'em out!

PPS; Special thank you's to Carpe Diem Construction for the design of the logo,  Koofreh Umoren for helping to make this video, the artists involved making so much beauty.. and to Don Shump from the Philadelphia Bee Company.

PPPS; and BIG thank you's to my advisors, my main man, friends/family, AND to my ~*~baby girl~*~; who give me a universe of inspiration and encouragement .. and the courage to Dream Big..  out loud :).

Photo by; Kelsi Windmiller
story_txt:
Hello There!
I'm Barbara, the creator of products and head of branding at U-Bee-Well ™. Off the bat, I'll be honest.. I NEVER thought I would be a business owner. AND, honestly, I never really knew what being an entrepreneur was all about until last year. I'm coming off of a deep pursuit of folk music. Before that, I was a teacher. Go figure. In my pursuit of music with The Spinning Leaves (the band I am in), I wanted to use music as a tool to create community and build bridges between people everywhere. In the time I was highly focused on making my livelihood with The Spinning Leaves, we connected and became quite attached to both farming and crafting movements ALL over this country. After spending a month on a farm in New Hampshire that we landed on 
during one of our first tours, my mind and heart opened up to TRUE 
connection - human to human, human to planet, food from the ground.  Our
 last morning on the farm, I woke up heartbroken to leave, deeply 
knowing that this experience had forever changed my life.  I did not 
know, however, the ENORMOUS impact it would have on my life's work and 
how that month would spawn a new way of living for me, entirely. The only thing that has remained consistent in my life, through it all, is that I want to make this world a better place.  My strange path to becoming a business owner has not always been easy, but the challenge is worth it.  Not only will U-Bee-Well be supporting beekeepers, farmers, and the communities that surround them, we will be directly advocating for the world's bees - the pollinators of the earth and a vital link in the world's food chain.  I am confident that I've found my vehicle for bettering the world - in lip balm!  photo by; Kelsi WindmillerMy heart and soul got into U-Bee-Well once I started developing a relationship with the Philadelphia Bee Guild  http://www.phillybeekeepers.org  and the Philadelphia Bee Company , http://philadelphiabee.com  learning the true value of bees as pollinators and the problems which they are facing in our modern age.  One BIG problem facing bee colonies today in our region, is the fact that most queen bees are raised in the south and shipped north.  It is very hard for these queens to adjust to the northern climates, and many of them die off.  With the queen gone, the hives collapse.I saw an opportunity to help change this situation.Initially, 10% of funds from U-Bee-Well's future accounts will go specifically into a queen bee rearing program for independent bee keepers in the northeast. The BIG VISION is that, as sales increase, we will be able to start supporting independent beekeepers all over the country and all over the world.
We are turning buying a lip balm into an opportunity for everyone to help save the bees! 
  "Buy A Balm.  Save A Bee."  It's a solution which doesn't involve you building your own hive or planting your own garden (although it would be fantastic if everyone did this, not so realistic..).  photo by; Kelsi Windmiller**U-Bee-Well is in a unique situation to do good.  Although we are a tiny start-up, we have accrued national accounts with prestigious companies such as the likes of Anthropologie and Birchbox.   And we can't let these opportunities pass by.  We need to head straight for the BIG VISION now!**By contributing to this campaign you will be helping on so many levels. You will be not only helping a heart-felt start up with a FANTASTIC product(!!!), YOU will be helping farms, farmers, the communities that surround those farms AND bees!
In short, I hope to help save MILLIONS and BILLIONS of bees with my endeavors here at U-Bee-Well. It is so important for ALL of us, and so I'm hoping that you will open your mind and heart to help make this business grow! What We Need & What You Get**Ideally, I will raise $18,000 through this campaign. This money will help with;~Getting U-Bee-Well's online branding together (making sure that it is clear EVERYWHERE that when someone buys a balm they can feel SO good about not only having a great product, but also that they are helping the world at large!)~Buying Materials so I can hand craft the 15k lip balms!~Getting a good Website!~I need to update my equipment so I can make many more lip balms at a time!~I would REALLY love to get a little machine that will help me put the labels on perfectly~Some costly business fees, licenses and things.....*IF I don't make my goal, my priority will be to buy the materials to make 15,000 lip balms.EVERYTHING will help, and buying supplies will certainly be a big deal in itself.. otherwise, not sure how I'm going to produce so many lip balms!…***There are INCREDIBLE gifts that you can choose from in this campaign!  In addition to the gifts, PLEASE remember that your contributions will also be a gift knowing that YOU were part of making this world a better place! With that said..I am VERY very VERY excited to present this list of artists, artisans, and craftsman who have all agreed to lend a helping hand for our campaign.  Some of the artists are established, and some are up and coming. The majority of the prizes have a bumble bee theme to them.  I have pretty much used this campaign to produce my ideal store. I am hoping that through this, YOU will also fall in love with the artists involved! Some of the gifts will require some communication with me.. AND I love and encourage that communication.In the event finances are not possible for you to contribute, simply sharing this link with your friends and families means the world!! (Thank you for THAT in advance).Thank you so much again, for taking a few moments to watch the video, to learn about U-Bee-Well and for your support. Alright, Lets DO this!!~BarbaraPS; Ohhh! If you LOVE the song playing, it was written by James Michael Baker (AKA Rumi Kitchen, from Johnny Showcase) and the group is The Spinning Leaves! Check 'em out!PPS; Special thank you's to Carpe Diem Construction for the design of the logo,  Koofreh Umoren for helping to make this video, the artists involved making so much beauty.. and to Don Shump from the Philadelphia Bee Company.PPPS; and BIG thank you's to my advisors, my main man, friends/family, AND to my ~*~baby girl~*~; who give me a universe of inspiration and encouragement .. and the courage to Dream Big..  out loud :).Photo by; Kelsi Windmiller

story:
About Me:

  My name is Daniel Collins and I am a 27 year old graduate of University of Maryland College Park.  I am a handyman, plumber, inventor, educator, artist, writer, event coordinator, and entrepreneur.  I attended an internship with Earthships Biotecture in 2011 because I had a dream and could tell that they would be able to help me.  I have also participated in the Maryland General Assembly (state government) as a legislative intern and constituent correspondent. 

My Project:

  I aim to create a collection of ecologically responsible structures in an accessible location close to MD and VA.  These buildings would together make an eco-campus where research on sustainable techniques can be performed and any functional community-life-supporting area is an open classroom.  This is important to me because I believe that it is our responsibility as a species to evolve our living practices and consciously seek balance and environmental harmony in all of our habitats. 

  This facility will generate credibility, research, education, and enthusiasm for the green revolution that is waiting in the wings.  With my biotecture degree I will also be LEED (leaders in ecological engineering and design) certified.  LEED is the national standard for environmental buildings and code.  Therefore not only will you be empowering my personal vision, but you will empower the movement by creating a recognized professional "green" building inspector/consultant.  Also, as a plumber and a former legislative assistant in the Maryland General Assembly; I intend to use my new level of credibility to propose ecological and water-management legislature that paves the way for more environmentally responsible building projects.  I am committed to our planet, our species, our country, and with the right credentials I just may be able to serve all with my efforts.

How to Help and Why:

  I need $4,000.  This will cover the $2,000 tuition, $1500 for room and board, $500 for travel and emergency funds.  I am going to the Earthship Academy no matter what and if I cannot make my $4,000 goal i will be using whatever I do get to get there.

  My perks are designed to connect you to my journey and let everyone know that you gave this project its start.  They range from personal video conferences and video blog shout-outs to your very own strap-case (a hand decorated hard-case combination-lock messenger bag of my own design) or even a permanent dedication on the finished campus.  

  This project will help inspire and empower individuals to live more sustainably.  It will be an aesthetically pleasing and practical park-like environment where you can take the kids for a summer day camp, attend a weekend organic gardening seminar or drop by for lunch and local produce.  

  I am a born entrepreneur and have cooperatively launched three successful start-up businesses which are still operating.  I am a co-founder of: Beautiful Day Landscaping, Green Scene Catering, and Foundation Event Coordination.  I am also the designer of the Greenmount Avenue Commons amphitheater park in Baltimore.  

  Not only am I personally capable and tenacious in the pursuit of my dreams, I am a great organizer of people and have a vast network of supporters and volunteers waiting for the green light to build a new type of school and community.  I would love to count you among us so we can change the way we live together.

  If you can't afford to donate to my project, don't worry, you can still help!!  Spread the word and get in contact with me about volunteer opportunities.  No matter what your gift is we need it.  Please share this page with your friends, post it on your facebook, and think about how we can make this dream a reality.
